TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
Having played this game for years, I was shocked to realize that I had never actually built an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, so, after some work, I built my The Sky's the Limit series of <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>'s

The one I am entering into the K prize is the SI-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-4 "The Sky's the Limit Cargo Edition"

Link to Imgur Album

[https://imgur.com/a/OeLyx](https://imgur.com/a/OeLyx)

Also wow. Congrats on Thread of the Year! Amazing job!

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-09T00:59:09Z" title="01/09/2018 12:59  AM" data-short="6 yr">January 9, 2018</time> by Steel Starling**
  
Didn't read the news....
Congrats on getting TOTY!!!  ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Would like to congratulate [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) for achieving thread of the year! Way to go! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

From [nearby thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/169280-the-go-anywhere-vessel-again/):

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, Marschig said:
> 
> 
> [![wywUDV9.png](https://i.imgur.com/wywUDV9.png)](https://i.imgur.com/wywUDV9.png "Enlarge image")
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://kerbalx.com/Marschig/Cruise-Plane-Mk2](https://kerbalx.com/Marschig/Cruise-Plane-Mk2)  [https://imgur.com/a/bvEHK](https://imgur.com/a/bvEHK)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 49.836 t  
> <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> 0.95  
> 
> Bodies: Laythe 0.95  
> 
> Moho-in-one: 0.9  
> 
> Science Package 0.9  
> 
> Six Kerbals 0.9  
> 
> Quick Start to Joolian Moon 0.85  
> 
> 63 parts 0.9
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 49.836\*0.95\*0.95\*0.9\*0.9\*0.9\*0.85\*0.9=**25.083**
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/619iEykH7mw?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
>

Once more, with gusto: a kinda-sorta flying wing to Duna and back, <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr> only.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2gQZNI4UGxo?feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

Many thanks to [@Cupcake...](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/62843-cupcake/), who gave me the idea of [flying wings](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=za-ZTlQpR2Q), and [@herbal space program](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112590-herbal-space-program/) with his [Duna Moth](https://imgur.com//a/PuVuE) who gave me a destination: being dependent on the <abbr title="Mechjeb (mod)">MJ</abbr> clicky-thingy, aerobatics are totally beyond me. I needed a mission to perform.

This is actually the fourth or fifth time I've done that mission now, also with a [proper flying wing](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/168274-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back-modded-version/&do=findComment&comment=3256349) over in the Modded K-Prize thread. So I was able to do the flight in a single afternoon, almost without saveloading (almost... landing in the wild was much easier with the bigger vessel). Coming to terms with video editing took the better part of a week, though. My first flick! I hope you'll like it.

I finally got a Spaceplane into orbit and back using Mk3 parts! Since its purpose is to ferry groups of Kerbals to and from space stations and motherships, I called it the Spacebus.

I didn't have an entry in the v1.3 Spaceplane challenge yet, so this is my entry. (I already proudly display the badge from a 1.2.1 entry though).

![Zfi9yni.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/Zfi9yni.jpg)

I'll be putting the whole mission up here in spoilers, with a few key pictures in the main post.

Spoiler

I play a stock game with 3 mods: Galileo Planet Pack, <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr> and <abbr title="Kerbal Alarm Clock (mod)">KAC</abbr>. The plane is therefore all stock parts, and stock physics. I used no clipped parts, except for a small nosecone clipped into the RAPIERs. Other than that, what you see is what you get.

![PZy0YRs.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/PZy0YRs.jpg)

Happy faces ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

![oR3zBXN.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/oR3zBXN.jpg)

The plane reaches Mach 1 without a problem.

![biPdQBh.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/biPdQBh.jpg)

However, there the engines struggle to accelerate. This is overcome by putting the plane into a 1000 m shallow dive.

![Xzq9i41.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/Xzq9i41.jpg)At 500 m/s, the pilot can pull up, and although that maneuver will cause the plane to slow to about 420 m/s, the plane will now continue to accelerate as the shock cones feed enough air into the engines.

![kqSm5yH.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/kqSm5yH.jpg)  

At about 24 km altitude, the plane switches to rocket-mode (RAPIER Closed Cycle).

Spoiler

![tM49sBY.png](https://i.imgur.com/tM49sBY.png)

From there on, it is quite a standard exercise to get into orbit: Apoapsis to 75 km... glide into space, and raise the Periapsis too. The only trick is to turn off the central 2 RAPIERS, because they are not aligned with the Center of Mass. This is by design, and made easy by pressing "3" (action group 3).

![LFEMJac.png](https://i.imgur.com/LFEMJac.png)

The <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> in the Galileo Pack is not located at the equator, so I had to correct 9 degrees (7 degrees left in the picture below).

![jZpoVXI.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/jZpoVXI.jpg)

Once in orbit, the Space plane had a little rendezvous with a lost Kerbal.

![wz7XRmo.png](https://i.imgur.com/wz7XRmo.png)

Spoiler

The poor soul must have had a space plane too, but it totally disintegrated and only the inline cockpit was left.

![EVXVpUJ.png](https://i.imgur.com/EVXVpUJ.png)

Doodwin (I *like* that name) boarded the functioning space plane...

![rpPfRtH.png](https://i.imgur.com/rpPfRtH.png)

![E7MsTih.png](https://i.imgur.com/E7MsTih.png)

Doodwin got to travel back home in economy class though.

![d46FhX2.png](https://i.imgur.com/d46FhX2.png)

After picking up Doodwin Kerman, the Periapsis was lowered to 30 km...

![s3QwM6e.png](https://i.imgur.com/s3QwM6e.png)

The plane comes with a couple of rather pointless <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> thrusters at the nose to keep the nose up a little longer in the atmosphere.

![JSSYyBU.png](https://i.imgur.com/JSSYyBU.png)

With the size and mass of the plane, these 4 thrusters were insufficient to make much of an impact. But that didn't matter much because the Kerbals entered the atmosphere a little early and didn't want to slow down at all.

![73VJJjO.png](https://i.imgur.com/73VJJjO.png)

The plane was wonderfully heat-resistant. Only one control surface got really hot (which was surprising).

![Acwmi33.png](https://i.imgur.com/Acwmi33.png)

At around 14 km, the engines were ignited again to fly to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>.

![cxrATcB.png](https://i.imgur.com/cxrATcB.png)

A left turn was needed to get to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> (because of the earlier plane change).

![QcjG7SV.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/QcjG7SV.jpg)

Final approach. Not really aligned with the runway, but whatever... At least it's heading towards it!

![KpGA8w8.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/KpGA8w8.jpg)

Spoiler

The Galileo Planet Pack <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> is surrounded by mountains, but their height was slightly overestimated. A rather steep dive was needed before the landing...

![u1T88l1.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/u1T88l1.jpg)

Finally the plane was somewhat aligned with the runway.

![Yx3sRVe.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/Yx3sRVe.jpg)

And back home, with 1 new crew member.

![UgWEHFI.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/UgWEHFI.jpg)

Spoiler

For the hell of it, I made the plane taxi to the <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>, and let the Kerbals climb out. (Otherwise, why put ladders on the plane?).

![fsfZoJs.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/fsfZoJs.jpg)

![RuLA1pQ.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/RuLA1pQ.jpg)

![zbF4FNu.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/zbF4FNu.jpg)

Thanks [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) for keeping this challenge alive for so long. It's a great source for inspiration to see what all the other people have created.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-21T16:00:01Z" title="01/21/2018 04:00  PM" data-short="6 yr">January 21, 2018</time> by Magzimum**

Congratulations to...

[@Steel Starling](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173159-steel-starling/)  Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award with SI-<abbr style="background-color:#ffffff;border-bottom:none;color:#353c41;font-size:14px;" title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-4 "The Sky's the Limit Cargo Edition".

[@Laie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/110461-laie/)- Expeditionary Astrokerbal Distinction (Duna), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Flying Wing Kind of Thing.

[@Magzimum](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167187-magzimum/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Spacebus.

... for successfully completing the K-Prize challenge. Thanks for your mission reports and welcome new arrivals and returning prizewinners to the K-Prize roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list. 

Among the gatecrashers ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") sorry to say [@Marschig](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167206-marschig/) because although Cruise Plane Mk2 is an accomplished, extensive and entertaining mission in its own right... it nevertheless refuelled by mining & refining fuel at Laythe etc and used the fuel as propellant which breaks proviso C. So it is linked as a gatecrasher on the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> with a quip as below. FYI it is the K-Prize tradition you can have the gatecrasher listing expunged by completing the K-Prize mission successfully if you so wish but can also retain the listing if you prefer. Thanks for participating ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") .

 [Marschig](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3265339) glossed over refining-refuelling at Laythe, denied being a rulebreaker saying, "the rules were like that when I found them".

Can i still do this 6 years later?

I'm aiming to launch a mission to Duna, achieve orbit, send another spaceplane, dock at Duna, and land back at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> (only orbiting Duna) (landing with the vessel which has both space crafts docked). What would that award me with?

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-28T20:43:30Z" title="01/28/2018 08:43  PM" data-short="6 yr">January 28, 2018</time> by Aiden.J**

> 
> 
> On 1/28/2018 at 8:34 PM, Aiden.J said:
> 
> 
> Can i still do this 6 years later?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I'm aiming to launch a mission to Duna, achieve orbit, send another spaceplane, dock at Duna, and land back at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> (only orbiting Duna) (landing with the vessel which has both space crafts docked). What would that award me with?
> 

Only one way to find out !

Its a Kosmokerbal Commendation for entering Duna <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr> and an Advanced Pilot Precision Award for docking, '1stClass' if you return to the runway as well.

The rules are all laid out in [the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/) fyi ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Am I correct that no one has tried the *Altitudinalist* record? I can't find any such awards.

About the requirements, is it full orbit (both <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr> and <abbr title="Periapsis">Pe</abbr>) beyond Eeloos orbit or just the <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr>?

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, dvader said:
> 
> 
> Am I correct that no one has tried the *Altitudinalist* record? I can't find any such awards.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> About the requirements, is it full orbit (both <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr> and <abbr title="Periapsis">Pe</abbr>) beyond Eeloos orbit or just the <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr>?
> 

AP only, its intended to be a kerbolar system altitude record and it hasn't been achieved by any entries in recent versions to the best of my knowledge.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-02-02T10:08:05Z" title="02/02/2018 10:08  AM" data-short="6 yr">February 2, 2018</time> by boolybooly**
Are you allowed to use slingshot maneuvers once out in the solar system or is it more of a max <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> challenge only?
Any which way you can, there are no rules about slingshots, except that they qualify for a Kosmokerbal Commendation.

I just discovered this topic despite its *age*, and would like to present this work:

![lZ8AVgl.png](https://i.imgur.com/lZ8AVgl.png)

(A year old project now)

![OZSNiUw.png](https://i.imgur.com/OZSNiUw.png)

![mXcKhXO.png](https://i.imgur.com/mXcKhXO.png)

Despite its appearance, Pallas is able to carry five consent subjects on a low Kerbin's orbit, one of the Mk1 Cabin being offset in the Mk2 adapter.

![ky5iNxa.png](https://i.imgur.com/ky5iNxa.png)

![8aXMBKA.png](https://i.imgur.com/8aXMBKA.png)

![PtoZFRH.png](https://i.imgur.com/PtoZFRH.png)

![4SQUFMN.png](https://i.imgur.com/4SQUFMN.png)

![4gjqsN1.png](https://i.imgur.com/4gjqsN1.png)

[Here is the album of the whole flight (a bit long).](https://imgur.com/a/CUua7)

Being a henchman of the F2 key it is often not possible to see the fuel level, and also it is impossible to check the level on the single screenshot taken while being docked at the station, but the only transfer I made was to exchange one of the Kerbal on board with a scientist lying in the station for a long time.

Thanks for your mission report [@XB-70A](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144985-xb-70a/) on the flight of the Pallas, which has been linked on the front page as per the (ancient ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")) traditions of the K-Prize, congratulations on earning an Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class for docking in orbit as well as returning for a runway landing. Welcome to the K-Prize party guest list and roll of honour.

HMB.

My entry, The Kerbero V. It is my first cargo <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> and is capable of putting small satellites or ion probes into an <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>. It makes a gliding approach back to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> from orbit, and often does not need to use it's engines after re-entry until it taxis back to a hangar on the ground.

[https://imgur.com/a/TgRUv](https://imgur.com/a/TgRUv) 

And yes, 1.4. How many others so far?

All K-Prize mission controllers are very welcome to publish further mission reports as they wish. If you look over the front page roll of honour you will see additional award links included beneath original mission reports with a dash in front. Please feel at liberty to pursue and report any challenge kudos missions you find interesting.

GL, HF and thanks for participating.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-12T09:43:18Z" title="03/12/2018 09:43  AM" data-short="6 yr">March 12, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

While waiting for the Expansion with a big E, I set out to finally help that unloved Altitudinalist record which no one seems to care for. (I also wanted to practice my slingshotting skills)

I wasn't planning on anything excessive, but 2340 years mission time could perhaps be considered a bit silly. Thanks to BetterTimeWarp it was perfectly enjoyable though. By the way, does that put me in the modded category or is that just for mod parts? I also had <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr>, <abbr title="Kerbal Alarm Clock (mod)">KAC</abbr>, PreciseNode and PlaneMode installed (no MechJeb, trajectories or autopilots).

Here's the full story with plenty of screenshots:

[https://imgur.com/a/FNvvs](https://imgur.com/a/FNvvs)

Here's the nothing special plane taking off. Liquid fuel only (and stock parts only). About 4000 <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> left after Kerbin orbit.

![db4tVRQ.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/db4tVRQ.jpg)

I slingshotted past Eve and Kerbin a couple of times (and got a tiny Jool flyby on the way back).

![49gVrRq.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/49gVrRq.jpg)![CIKJYdZ.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/CIKJYdZ.jpg)

And 1161 years later, we are at 4753 Gm! Kerbol is bigger than expected.

![HlFQS8T.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/HlFQS8T.jpg)

Going back required even more slingshotting. But I finally landed (after two reloads which should be blamed on a crappy pilot with a poorly calibrated joystick).

Not much has changed in 2340 years. I guess Kerbals aren't the progressive types...

![k7r5z31.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/k7r5z31.jpg)

The maximum <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr> was 4,753,783,667,685 m.

Made my first <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> in Making History (Probably the first one on this thread), since Making History is a DLC its not a mod, right? (The images where edited with imigur)

I had a little trouble with Imigur so i gave you the link. The album can be found here: [https://imgur.com/a/VxPJs](https://imgur.com/a/VxPJs)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-15T20:15:42Z" title="03/15/2018 08:15  PM" data-short="6 yr">March 15, 2018</time> by The Moose In Your House**
  
Fixing the Imigur link
